results.title: Changing our minds: the story of Dr. Evelyn Hooker
results.creator_credit: Intrepid Productions, David Haugland and Richard Schmiechen
results.brief_description: This fascinating documentary is a biography of Dr. Evelyn Hooker, whose research into the psychological profile of homosexual men was instrumental in the eventual declassification of homosexuality as a mental illness. Prior to Hooker’s research homosexuals and lesbians endured a range of psychiatric treatment including lobotomies, aversion therapy and hormone injections to treat their “disease”. Hooker began her research in 1954, with encouragement from a gay colleague who convinced her that psychiatric definitions of sexuality had been under-researched. Over the next fifteen years her research convinced her that psychologically it was impossible to distinguish between heterosexual and homosexual profiles. In 1974, Hooker and other progressive psychologists - in tandem with lesbian and gay activists - succesfully petitioned the American Psychiatric Association to drop its definition of homosexuality as a pathological mental illness. This moving biography includes interviews with Hooker and archival documentation of the “underground” lesbian and homosexual communities in America during the 1950s and 1960s. “Changing Our Minds” was nominated for an Academy Award in 1993 for Best Feature Documentary. Narrated by Patrick Stewart.

results.title: Cecil B. Demented
results.creator_credit: Studio Canal, Artic Productions, John Fiedler, Joe Caracciolo Jr, Mark Tarlov and John Waters
results.brief_description: John Water’s Cecil B Demented is an anarchic kick to the bloated carcus that is mainstream Hollywood feature films. No one escapes Waters’ skewered assault as he derides the mediocrity that now inhabits the American studio system. The plot is a compendium of Waters’ previous film work and favorite obsessions, offering up kidnapping, demented ciniphiles, scathing parodies (the highlight being the Forest Gump sequel, ‘Gumped again’) and highly specific sexual perversity. Steven Dorf stars as Cecil B Demented, the deranged leader of the ‘Sprocket Holes’, a gang of film fanatics hell bent on overthrowing the Hollywood A-list and out to “punish bad cinema”. Their insane plan involves kidnapping megalomanic movie star Honey Whitlock (Melanie Griffith relishing her role as the bitchy diva) and forcing her to appear in their own underground movie. What ensues is a wild parody of hollywood movie making, while Waters affectionately sends up his own days as a filmmaking terrorist. Cast includes: Alicia Witt, Mink Stole, Ricki Lake, Patricia Hearst, Adrien Grenier, Larry Gillard Jr.

results.title: Cats & dogs = Cats and dogs [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Andrew Lazar, Chris DeFaria, Warren Zide, Craig Perry and Lawrence Guterman
results.brief_description: A young beagle finds himself a player in a canines versus felines war when he is introduced to the Brody family. Now named Lou, he is quickly acquainted with Butch, Chief Agency Dog, who introduces him to fellow agents Peek and Sam, as well as tracing the origins of mission he is now an integral part of - Action Plan Delta. Action Plan Delta comprises of replacing the previous catnapped pet, Buddy, and guarding the Brody home from cat invasion. The cats are intent on entering the household to gain access to a serum Mr Brody has been perfecting - a serum which prevents dog allergies. In the wrong hands (paws), the serum could be reversed and create widespread dog allergies, thus allowing cats to become man’s best friend. Leader of the cat movement is a white feline with the undignified name of Mr Tinkles. When the cats infiltrate the Brody home the dogs cast a vote as to whether they should save family or formula. Featuring impressive special effects, “Cats & dogs” presents an interesting take on the spy/action genre (Mission Impossible in particular), with all that you’d expect to see in such a film: secret agents, Russian spies, inventive weapons and perverse interrogation techniques. It’s also concerned about the love between man and pet - with dogs in particular. Voices provided by Tobey Maguire (Lou), Alec Baldwin (Butch), Sean Hayes (Mr Tinkle), Susan Sarandon (Ivy), Michael Clarke Duncan (Sam) Joe Pantoliano (Peek) and Charlton Heston (the Mastiff). Cast also includes Elizabeth Perkins and Miriam Margolyes. Creature effects by Jim Henson’s Creature Shop.

results.title: Cat people
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, RKO Radio Pictures, Charles Fries and Paul Schrader
results.brief_description: A re-make of the 1942 horror classic starring Nastassia Kinski, Malcolm McDowell and John Heard. Irena is a beautiful young woman on the brink of exploring her sexuality. The experience brings tragic consequences and pushes her towards her bizarre destiny as her past and present collide. The orginal story held that an ancient race of women mated with big cats in the dawn of time. To become human again after mating, the “Cat people” must kill. Irena, who is in love with a human is condemned to repeat the patterns of her ancestors.

results.title: Cat Ballou
results.creator_credit: Harold Hecht Corporation, Harold Hecht and Elliot Silverstein
results.brief_description: Lee Marvin stars as both Tim Strawn (a noseless gunslinger) and Kid Shelleen, the woozy, boozy has-been who goes up against Strawn at high noon. Jane Fonda, at the height of her sex-kitten period, stars as Cat Ballou, the schoolmarm-turned outlaw who teams with Kid to protect her father’s ranch from a greedy railroad tycoon. One of the biggest box office hits of 1965, “Cat Ballou” was declared an instant classic with its sly blend of Western parody and rapid-fire action. Directed by Elliot Silverstein.

results.title: Casualties of war
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Art Linson and Brian De Palma
results.brief_description: Hailed by critics as a masterpice, this film is based on the true story of a squad of U.S. soldiers caught in the moral dilemma of wartime Vietnam. Witness to a vile crime, Private Ericksson (Michael J. Fox) is forced to stand alone against his fellow soldiers and commanding officer Sergeant Meserve (Sean Penn), a powerful and charismatic man pushed over the edge of barbarism by the terror and brutality of combat. With sweeping scope, action and raw power, master filmmaker, Brian De Palma creates a devastating and unforgettable tale of one man’s quest for sanity and justice amidst the chaos of war. Based upon the book by Daniel Lang.

results.title: Castle of Cagliostro [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Tokio Movie Shinsha Company, Tetsuo Katayama and Hayao Miyazaki
results.brief_description: The character of Lupin III, created by manga artist Monkey Punch, was already a pop culture icon in Japan when this film was released in 1980. Based on an earlier character—Maurice Leblanc’s dashing, turn-of-the-century gentleman thief, Arsene Lupin—the gadget wielding trickster Lupin III had appeared in comics, a television series and a previous feature film. In ‘The Castle of Cagliostro’ Miyazaki remains reasonably true to the original characters—he had written and directed some of the TV episodes himself—but his film also has the mark of a Miyazaki original. After performing a daring casino heist, Lupin and his sidekick discover the money they have stolen is counterfeit. Tracing the bills to the tiny European duchy of Cagliostro, Lupin immediately sets off with his partners in crime, a retired gangster, a modern-day samurai, and a beautiful female thief. Upon arrival they find themselves caught up in a fiendish plot involving counterfeit money, a hidden treasure, a princess locked away in the highest tower of a castle, and the evil Count Cagliostro. Flawlessly combining high action, broad comedy, romance, and mystery, with beautiful detailed animation, the film is considered a milestone in the anime genre. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Casino [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Barbara de Fina and Martin Scorsese
results.brief_description: Based on material gathered for a non-fiction book by Nicholas Pileggi, “Casino” takes an in depth look at the behind the scenes world of a casino whilst following the history of the mob in Las Vegas. It is 1973 and Sam Rothstein (Robert de Niro) is sent by the mob to manage the Tangiers casino. Sam’s childhood friend Nicky Santoro (Joe Pesci), follows him to Vegas whereupon he’s hired to enforce mob control. Sam’s successful running of the Tangiers is soon jeopardised by Nicky’s hotheaded thuggery and the explosive behaviour of his coke-addicted wife Ginger (Sharon Stone). “Casino” is Martin Scorsese’s tribute to a Las Vegas now gone. The film is marked with Scorsese’s usual visual flair and kinetic style, with a deadpan voiceover narration from Sam and occasionally Nicky. Sharon Stone gives a knockout performance as the unstable Ginger.

results.title: Cars
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Pixar Animation Studios, Darla Anderson and John Lasseter
results.brief_description: Hotshot race car Lightning McQueen (given voice by Owen Wilson) is living life in the fast lane until he hits a detour on his way to the most important race of his life. Stranded in Radiator Springs, a forgotten town on the old Route 66, he meets Sally, Mater, Doc Hudson (Paul Newman) and a variety of quirky characters who help him discover that there’s more to life than trophies and fame. Another hit animated feature from the studios of Pixar that will delight young and young-at-heart audiences alike. Also features the voices of Cheech Marin, Tom Hanks, Billy Crystal, John Goodman and many others. Original score composed and conducted by Randy Newman.

results.title: Carrington
results.creator_credit: Dora Productions, Ronald Shedlo, John McGrath and Christopher Hampton
results.brief_description: Dora Carrington (Emma Thompson) devotes her life to writer Lytton Strachey (Jonathan Pryce) a tall, thin, bearded bachelor and member of London’s famed Bloomsbury artistic set. Even though their desire for each other was strong, their relationship was purely based on friendship, a bond that lives until the very end. This is one of the most unusual love stories you will ever see.
